intro: Chaetogastra stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
